data.price: those who say, “Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.”
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: Those who are patient, truthful, devout, charitable, and who seek forgiveness before dawn[9].
data.arabic: ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ وَٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ وَٱلۡقَٰنِتِينَ وَٱلۡمُنفِقِينَ وَٱلۡمُسۡتَغۡفِرِينَ بِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ
data.footnotes: [9] The Prophet (ﷺ) said: “Our Lord, glory be His, descends every night to the lowest Heaven, when only the last third of it remains, and He says: “Who is there to supplicate Me so that I may answer him? Who is there to ask of Me so that I may give him? Who is there to seek My forgiveness so that I may forgive him?””. [Al-Bukhāri: 1145, Muslim: 758]

dua.name: Dua for Forgiveness
dua.significanceReason: Powerful invocation seeking divine forgiveness, mercy, and protection from hellfire. Universally recited for spiritual cleansing and redemption.
